alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 12 at 8:19PM MST until January 13 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, sustained west winds 30 to 40 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH. For the High Wind Watch, sustained southwest winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 70 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 8 AM MST Friday. For the High Wind Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.
